poem:
Title: "Upon The Unquiet Sea"

Cries, whispers, some silenced - all stranded,
As P&O danced to Mammon's call.
Unmoved, the sands of justice, time branded,
Firm footing found in puppet's hall.

Adrift in tides of greed, bathed in scorn,
Barefoot hearts seek shelter from the storm.
Yet no quill of law paints dawn reborn,
For lawmakers commune with worms.
